perturbation.original_text:
5.1 License Fees. In consideration of the licenses granted and other undertakings by Licensor hereunder, Licensee shall pay Licensor a License Fee
in
the
amount
of
two
hundred
thousand
dollars
(US$200,000)
(“License Fee”).
The License Fee shall be due and payable as follows:
(a) US$50,000
upon
signing
the
Memorandum
of
Understanding
(“MOU”)
between
the
Parties
(provided,
however,
that
Licensor
hereby
acknowledges receipt of this portion of the License Fee);
(b) US$50,000 upon signing of this Agreement; and
(c) US$100,000 upon on or before March 28, 2014.
The License Fees are non-cancellable and non-refundable.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 License Fees. In consideration of the licenses granted and other undertakings by Licensor hereunder, Licensee shall pay Licensor a License Fee
in
the
amount
of
two
hundred
thousand
dollars
(US$200,000)
(“License Fee”).
The License Fee shall be due and payable as follows:
(a) US$50,000
upon
signing
the
Memorandum
of
Understanding
(“MOU”)
between
the
Parties
(provided,
however,
that
Licensor
hereby
acknowledges receipt of this portion of the License Fee);
(b) US$50,000 upon signing of this Agreement; and
(c) US$100,000 upon on or before March 28, 2014.
The License Fees are cancellable with a 30-day written notice and 50% refundable before the mentioned date.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction regarding the cancellability and refund policy of the License Fees. The original text states they are non-cancellable and non-refundable, but the modified text introduces a cancellation clause with a partial refund. This inconsistency creates uncertainty and potential disputes over the financial obligations of the Licensee.

perturbation.original_text:
5.3 Reports and Payment
(a) Not later than the fifteenth (15th) calendar day of each calendar quarter (or the first business day thereafter), Licensee shall deliver to
Licensor (i) a report accurately showing Gross Revenues of the Licensee for the previous quarter, the number of Subscribers on the last day of such
previous quarter and the amount of Royalties due thereon, and (ii) payment of the Royalties payable for such previous quarterbased on the Subscriber
information as reflected in the report. All payments under this Agreement shall be made in US dollars.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.3 Reports and Payment
(a) Not later than the fifteenth (15th) calendar day of each calendar quarter (or the first business day thereafter), Licensee shall deliver to
Licensor (i) a report accurately showing Gross Revenues of the Licensee for the previous quarter, the number of Subscribers on the last day of such
previous quarter and the amount of Royalties due thereon, and (ii) payment of the Royalties payable for such previous quarterbased on the Subscriber
information as reflected in the report. All payments under this Agreement shall be made in US dollars. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for the first year of this agreement, payment may be made within thirty (30) days of the end of each quarter.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by introducing an extended payment deadline for the first year of the agreement. The original clause mandates payment by the 15th of the following month, while the added sentence allows payment within 30 days. This conflicting timeframe creates ambiguity over when royalties are actually due, creating potential for disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
6.1 Term. The initial term of this Agreement commences as of the Effective Date and, unless terminated earlier pursuant to any express provision
of this Agreement, shall continue until five (5) years following the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). Thereafter, this Agreement shall renew
automatically for one (1) additional three (3) year period (the "Renewal Term" and collectively, together with the Initial Term, the "Term") unless
either party provides the other with written notice of non-renewal at least ninety (90) days before the expiration of the Initial Term].
perturbation.changed_text:
6.1 Term. The initial term of this Agreement commences as of the Effective Date and, unless terminated earlier pursuant to any express provision
of this Agreement, shall continue until five (5) years following the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). Thereafter, this Agreement shall renew
automatically for one (1) additional three (3) year period (the "Renewal Term" and collectively, together with the Initial Term, the "Term") unless
either party provides the other with written notice of non-renewal at least ninety (90) days before the expiration of the Initial Term]. Notwithstanding the foregoing, this agreement shall auto-renew indefinitely for successive one-year terms unless terminated by either party with 30 days written notice prior to the end of the then-current term.
perturbation.explanation: This change adds a clause introducing an indefinite auto-renewal with a 30-day notice period, directly contradicting the original clause which specifies a single three-year renewal term with a 90-day notice period. This creates significant uncertainty regarding the long-term commitment required by the agreement.
